prefixDef.p: Private URIs using the teiCorpusHeader prefix are pointers to any element in the SHAWI teiCorpus document.
Private URIs using the share prefix are pointers to audio file residing on the SHAWI network share.
Private URIs using the geo prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a place element in VICAV Geodata list.
Private URIs using the zotid prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a biblStruct element in the TEI export of the VICAV Zotero Group library.

spanGrp.span: When the prophet Moses, peace be upon him, was walking around on earth he came to a house and became a guest in there.
When he arrived in that house, he saw that it was a rich house which had a lot of money. There was no better house in the whole surroundings.
He knocked the door and said, “I want to be their guest here, let me say, I want to stay here today.”
But when he looked into the house, it was as quiet as a mouse in there (literally: there was not even the sound of a breath).
When he knocked the door they came out. The landlady came out and said to him, “Come in!”
He came, sat down inside (and they greeted each other saying,) “Peace be upon you! – Peace be upon you too!”
He said, “Indeed, your house is a nice house, the best house around.
But there is not even the sound of a breath in it. I did not see any children, no little children, nothing.”
They said, “Well, o prophet Moses, God has not given us children. We have been married for ten years, but we have no children.
We do not have sons nor do we have daughters.
O prophet Moses, go and pray to your God that he may give us a son; that’s what we really want.”
He said, “Give me the jug! I want to perform the ritual ablution.”
He took the jug, brought it outside and performed the ablution. Then he came back, stood up and started to pray.
After he had prayed, he opened his hands towards his Lord and said, “O my Lord, with your glory and majesty, give a son to this house!
They may have children and be happy.” The Lord of the Worlds did not answer him.
The prophet Moses; if prophets do not get any answer, they do not ask their Lord again.
When he came back to the house, they looked at him; the landlord looked at the prophet Moses, (but God) had not given him any answer.
He said, “Since the Lord of the Worlds has not given me any answer.” He replied to him, “(God) gave us no answer.”
Then the prophet Moses left that house and went away.
Time passed, some days or some weeks, when someone else came to this house.
He came, greeted and they greeted back. Then he said, “Your house is indeed” The one who came to them (this time) was not a prophet, just a fellow citizen.
He said, “What a pity, you have no offspring; you do not have sons, you do not have children.”
They said, “That’s right, we do not have any.” – “Why?” he said – “God did not give us, so we have not got children.”
“So, didn’t you go to a doctor, did not you go somewhere?”
(The landlord) said, “No! The prophet Moses came to us and we told (it) to the prophet Moses.”
Ismail, do you know this (story)? I told it before.

They said to him, “We told it to the prophet Moses and the prophet Moses prayed to his Lord, to the Lord of the Worlds. Perhaps he did not give him an answer and so the prophet Moses did not say anything to us. He stood up and went away.”
He said, “I see, that’s how it was.” He said, “Yes, like that.” The (guy) said, “Give me the jug!”
He took the pot, after he had taken the pot, he went performing ablution and prayed. After he had prayed
he stood up for prayer and prayed. After he had prayed, he took a bottle out of his pocket, something like a bottle, a can. He took it out of his pocket.
Then he opened his hand(s) towards his Lord and said, “O my Lord, you either give children to these or I will hit the ground with this bottle right now and ruin the earth and the skies.”
The Lord of the Worlds sent him a message saying, “Stop, my servant! I have already given them. So do not hit this bottle (on the ground)!”
When he came back to the house, they made a dinner or lunch for him; they served him lunch and dinner.

“What did you do?” He said, “You will have (children), don’t worry! The prayer worked.” He got up and went away. Those ones did not accept (the whole story) as the first one was a prophet and this one just someone else.
Indeed, time passed. When time had passed, these got children.
After the first-born child, they got another one, and after this one they became many children.
Every year the woman gave birth. After a long time (lit. time come, time go!) the prophet Moses came again to this house.
When the prophet Moses had arrived, he looked into the house and lo and behold, it was full of children.
Where did these children come from? Did they end up selling the house?
Did someone else come or what happened? He knocked the door of the house again.
A long time had passed, ten years, fifteen years had passed.
When the woman came out, lo and behold it was the very same woman.
They reckognized him. The prophet Moses has arrived! He said, “Prophet Moses, come in!”
When they said, “Come in!” he sat down and said, “Whose children are these?”
They said, “These children are ours.” He said, “You have got offspring?” They said, “Yes, we have got offspring.”
“The Lord of the Worlds gave (them) to us. I gave birth every year and our children have become many.”
The prophet Moses was astonished, started to perform the ablution, prayed and opened his hand towards his Lord.
He said, “O my Lord, with your glory and majesty. First, I prayed to you, how come that they did not get (children). So, why do they have offspring now?”
This time, the Lord of the Worlds sent him a message saying, “O Moses, one of my people came to me. I did not disappoint them and I gave them children.”
He said, “O my Lord, some of your people came in here?” He said, “Yes, from my people.”
He said “O my Lord, do you really have people?” He said, “O prophet Moses, the way you have people, so do I have people. I also have (a kind of) family.”
“How do you have family?” – “I also have family.” He said, “O my Lord, I want to get to know your people.
Lead me to them! Lead me to them, so I can go and meet them. I want to go to meet them; I really want to get to know them. Who are these, your people?
Those have to be your people to a high degree. (Because) I am a prophet of God and that guy is just anyone. However, you did not accept my prayer, but you did accept his prayer.
And that one took out a bottle from his pocket and wanted to hit the earth and ruin it. Who are these?”
He said, “O prophet Moses. You are not able (to compete) with them. These are many people, high-ranked people.”
He said, “O my Lord, I still want to get to know them.” He said, “Now that you are so self-confident,
go to that place, on that mountain, behind that mountain there! There are seven tents. In those seven tents there are my people.”
The prophet Moses took his stick and left. He went on and when he came from above the mountain ridge he saw the tents.
The tents were picked up; seven tents. Those (people) came out from the tents.
When they came out from the tents, they saw that someone was coming from the ridge and so the people of the tents saw him.
Everyone was mounting his horse and heading towards the prophet Moses. And everyone was saying, “This is my guest!” Everyone was saying, “This is my guest! He should stay at my place, in my tent!”
They came running towards the prophet Moses. When they came to the prophet Moses, he looked around.
Those people were coming to him. What’s up with them? What’s the matter?
When they had reached him everyone was saying, “O prophet Moses, you are (a guest) in my tent here!”
But actually, they did not know him and (the fact) that he was a prophet. This one said, “This is my guest!” That one said, “This is my guest!”
Eventually, as they could not come to an agreement, they drew their swords on each other.
They wanted to hit each other because of the guest. He said, “Hey people, stop it! A fight does not settle it!” “How should we do it?”
He said “Sir, blindfold my eyes and take me! I will walk around and to whose tent I point,
I will stay as a guest in that tent.”
They said, “Alright, highly agreed. Get up and blindfold his eyes!” Then they let him free and (returned) to their tents.
The prophet Moses was looking and looking around until he grabbed the rope of a certain tent and said, “I am a guest here in this tent.” And he stayed in that tent.
The people in that tent were happy. “Today this guest is at our place”. The people in the tent sat down: the owner of the tent and next to him somenone else.
He said to him, “What would our guest like to eat, so we can make food for him, a dish.”
The prophet Moses said “I” They said, “We would like to slaughter a ewe for you, we slaughter a lamb for you, we slaughter a cow for you, we slaughter for you what you want.”
He said, “I eat the meat of humans. I eat human flesh.”
“Human flesh?” He said, “Human flesh!” The owner of the tent got up, grabbed his mother and put her on the ground.
He pulled the knife and wanted to cut his mother’s (throat) in order to kill her.
His wife came in and said, “O my husband, what are you doing?” He said, “I want to kill my mother, so we can cook her for the guest.”
She said, “If you kill your mother she has a family and her family will come and say, ‘Why did you kill our woman?’
Kill me instead! Because you are my man.” He said, “You are right, your words are right.”
He got up, left his mother, grabbed his wife and dragged her to the ground. He grabbed the knife and wanted to cut off her head.
(In this moment) his son, the son of the family, came in and said, “Father, what are you doing?”
He said, “Son, I want to kill your mother, so I can cook her for the guest.”
He said, “Okay father, you did not kill my grandmother because she has family. But my mother also has a family.
They will also put you in jail. Kill me! Because of me, no one but God will call you to account.”
He said “Your words are even more agreeable.” He got up, left his wife, grabbed his son and dragged his little son to the ground.
When he had dragged him to the ground and grabbed the knife to cut his head, the prophet Moses nugded him.
He said, “What are you doing?” He said, “I want to slaughter my son for you!
He said, “Isn’t he for me?” He said, “Yes, he is for you. I want to slaughter him for you that you can eat him.”
He said “Maybe I will feel ashamed in front of you and cannot eat him. It will be hard for you.
Give him to me! I will take him to the mountain there. I will kill and eat him and then I’ll come back.”
He said, “Here you are!” He gave him his son, the prophet Moses took him, grabbed his hand, and then they left.
The prophet Moses brought him to the top of the mountain. There they were sitting, he and the boy.
The boy was waiting until the prophet Moses will kill him. He said to him, “Kid, come let’s play, you and me!”
He said, “What do we play, prophet Moses?” He said, “Let’s play hide-and-seek or blind man’s buff!” He said, “Alright, let’s play!”
The prophet Moses said, “Close your eyes, kid! I want to hide!”
The boy went ahead, closed his eyes, and the prophet Moses hid himself. After the prophet Moses had hidden himself,
the boy opened his eyes and looked into the seven skies, but the prophet Moses was not there. He looked on the earth, but the prophet Moses was not there.
He looked to the north, but he was not there, to the west, but he was not there, to the south, but he was not there, and to the east, but he was not there.
When he looked down into the seven seas, he found the prophet Moses behind a rock, stretching on a fish and hiding.
The boy called the prophet Moses saying, “O prophet Moses, you have broken the fish’s back! Enough! Come out!” So, he has found the prophet Moses.
The prophet Moses came out and the boy said, “O prophet Moses, now it is my turn. I want to hide and you have to find me!”
The prophet Moses closed his eyes and the boy hid himself. When the prophet Moses opened his eyes, he looked around:
Into the seven skies – nothing. Into the seven earths – nothing. The seven seas – nothing!
He looked to the north, but he was not there, to the south, but he was not there, to the west, but he was not there. The boy has vanished.
He said, “Come out, kid, I haven’t found you! Where are you? You are not here. I have been looking for you everywhere.”
He said, “O prophet Moses, I have become a hair in your moustache. Here I am!”
He had become a hair in his moustache saying, “Ha, here I am!” It turned out that he was a hair in his moustache.
He said to him, “Kid, go away! I cannot compete with you. Your rank must be high, higher than mine. I cannot keep up with you.”
He left him and went away. The prophet Moses left them and went away then. The boy returned to his family.
He was running and so they saw that he was alive. They said, “What happened?” He said, “Well, nothing, we did this and that.
And he is God’s prophet, he is the prophet Moses. He had gone away, left them. These are God’s people, God’s people.
They worship God and they do not know anything else but God. They only know God; they only know God’s sake.
They do not have anything else, neither the world’s pleasures nor anything else. By God’s will, maybe nowadays there is also something (like this), but I do not know. –God bless you!
